abstract: Wall Street’s bulls went running for cover on Thursday after a fusillade of new reports suggested the economy’s initial bounce from the bottom could be leveling off, stirring worry that the recovery would come in fits and starts over the rest of the year.

lead_paragraph: Wall Street’s bulls went running for cover on Thursday after a fusillade of new reports suggested the economy’s initial bounce from the bottom could be leveling off, stirring worry that the recovery would come in fits and starts over the rest of the year.

headline.main: Shaky Pace of Recovery Sets Off a Sharp Decline
